Description: Shoulder sherd of North Ionian, possibly Clazomenian, black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: at top of shoulder frieze of alternating black and added red tongues; below, black-figure decoration consisting of bird flying right (tips of wings and tail feathers missing); on right, male figure to right, almost certainly a horse rider (part of head with ear, hair, shoulder, and right arm remaining) overlapping the tongue frieze; probable remains of horse on lower break.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For Clazomenian parallels, see British Museum 1888,0208.83.b from Tell Dafana, attributed to the Petrie Painter. For similar Corinthian iconography see British Museum 1888,0601.562.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.112) (phase 3)
van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 7, no. N 22)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 54, no 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2951 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
